description: {cThe river reaches a bridge here, sunk deep into the river bed, the
pillars of the bridge to the town of {wL{Wu{Cs{ck{Da{Wn{c.  There is a delicately
carved set of stone steps into the bridge, allowing access down into
the river.  Not far to the west, you can see the Sea of Swords.
30951.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: {wThis section of the High Road marks the highest point along the
entire length, and the views from here are spectacular.  The majestic,
and hostile, waters of the Sea of Swords can be seen to the west,
while to the east can be seen the wicked mountaintops of The Crags.
Far off in the distance to the north, the ominous peaks of The Spine
of the World stand proud.  {x
30956.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe High Road here starts a short, but dangerous, leg as it passes
adjacent to {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{w.  Though the road was built high on a
set of rolling hills to the east of the Mere, creatures from the Mere
will stray and climb up to the road.  {x
30915.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {cThe river reaches it's source, a huge waterfall, flowing down the
mountainside into a large pool.  It is the force of this water that
keeps the river from completely freezing over and becoming nothing but
a sheet of ice.  There is a dangerously slippery pathway up the side
of the mountain, that looks weathered by centuries of ice, snow, and a
bitter chilling wind.
30995.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: {wTo the south is Port Llast, the last outpost of civilization before
the barren wastelands of Icewind Dale to the northwest.  Built along
the coast on a small inlet of land, a harbor, holding a small handful
of boats, can be seen opening up to the vast waters of the Sea of
Swords.  {x
30945.name: {BN{borth {*of {BP{bort {BL{blast {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe a long and steady hill begins here and stretches out to the
north for a distance.  Conveniently located between the Mere and the
Sword Mountains, it offers the safest location for passage from the
southern cities to the frozen north.  {x
30917.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {DA distance below the High Road, the salty quagmire known as the
Mere of Dead Men sits along the coast.  Habitable only by those that
can tolerate the desolate swamp, it is fairly devoid of mammalian
creatures.  In the distance towards the southwest, some partially
submerged structures can be seen.
30963.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: {DHidden under the Mere of Dead Men is a small antechamber in the
castle ruins.  It is cold, damp and full of murky water from the swaps
above.  There appears to be a door leading further into the castle,
but the submerged castle below is so full of swamp waters that the
door cannot be opened.
30944.name: {DC{wa{Ws{wtl{De Na{re{Rry{rt{Dar A{wnt{Wecham{wbe{Dr{x

description: {DThe impassable {ymountains {Dcurve round to the north, creating a
natural {gboundry {Dto the {gforest{D.  The {gtrees {Dare less thick here as there
is less space for them to grow next to the {ymountains{D.  The {cwind {Dis
less {cfierce {Dhere, {gsheltered {Dby the small {ymountain {Drange to the north.
30974.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest{x

description: A small trail breaks off of the High Road to the east.  It leads
into a small dark forest.  The trees of the forest are extremely tall,
and very close together.  It prevents a lot of the light going
through.  The main road continues to run northward to the towns of the
frozen north, and far off in the south, the city of Waterdeep.
30926.name: {yA Split in the Road {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: There is a sharp bend up ahead along the road.  To the west it is
just possible to make out the sword coast as the road climbs higher
through the mountains.  The tracks made throughout the road are
becomming less noticeable as the road twists further north into the
mountains.
30903.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The bulk of the mountain range rises up to the south.  The High
Road appears to be emerging from those mountains, and along some hills
that stretch out to the north.  There are a few noticeable tracks that
wander along this part of the road, they dont appear to be humanoid in
size but somewhat larger.
30910.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The road to the north seems to be coming out of the mountain range
to the south and is beginning to slope down towards sea level.  The
main part of the mountain range looms to the east while the road now
moves along some cliffs leading down to the sword coast.  The waves
from the sea can be heard pounding away at the cliffs below.
30906.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe road continues along the ridgeline avoiding the hostile Mere,
rounding a hill to the east or continuing south.  To the east the
brutal Sword Mountains can be seen in their savage glory.  {x
30916.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {cRumbling sounds to the west signify a great flowing of water.  The
river is very fast moving here, breaking through the ice with speed.
The path of the river curves round to the south.
30994.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: {wThis well travelled portion of the road is easily marked with wheel
marks of hundreds of wagons and carts that have passed through here.
The High Road supplies the northern city of {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr{w with necessary
dry goods and supplies, essential for the city's economy and
well-being.  {x
30931.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {BS{bouth{B: {WN{we{Dv{Be{Dr{ww{Di{Bn{Dt{we{Wr
{BN{borth{B: {WN{we{Dv{Ge{Dr{ww{Di{Gn{Dt{we{Wr {GW{goods
{BP{bort {BL{blast{x
{xBeware the many dangers of the North. Many an
Orc or Goblin attack a weary traveller. Look out
for winter wolves, and other nasty creatures that
inhabit the woods and mountains close to the High
Road.
{wConstructed with the trunks of centuries old oak trees, this wooden
bridge was built to withstand both time and the heavy currents of
Neverwinter River rushing by down below.  The lifeblood of nearby
Neverwinter Woods, the river is the primary water supply of the city
of {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr{w.  {x
30938.name: {BB{bridge {BN{borth {*of {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wJust ahead appears to be the apex of the High Road along this
coastal cliffline, followed by a steady decline downwards towards
level ground.  The air up here is crisp, pure, and invigorating.  {x
30955.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {DHidden in the dirt is a small underground mausoleum.  Paintings of
{gwoodland {ycreatures{D, along with {gcreeping vines {Dcover the {ccold {wstone
{Dwalls.  In the corner, a large {ybrown {gtree root {Dpushes through the
{wstone {Dwalls which allows climbing access to the mausoleum.  {gSmall
plants {Dare {ygrowing {Dthrough the cracks in the floor where the {wstone
{Dslabs are joined, but the joins have been eroded a little over the
centuries.  The {wlight {Dfrom above penetrates through the hidden
entrance to the {wmausoleum{D, allowing all the {gplants {Dto {yflourish{D.  In
the centre of the {wmausoleum {Drests a large {wstone {Dtomb.  The lid looks
very heavy, but can probably be levered off with a good stronge
effort.
30998.name: {DThe {yD{gr{cu{gi{yd{c'{gs {DGrave{x

description: The High Road here continues over a series of hills.  Atop the
taller hills, the Mere of Dead Men can be seen to the south.  A
noticeable breeze passes over from the coast.
30921.name: {yNorth of {DT{gh{De M{ge{Dr{ge {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wBeginning here is the long trek northward towards Icewind Dale and
The Spine of the World.  Locals from Port Llast say the road ahead is
long and lonely, barren of places to re-supply, and recommend full
rest and provisions before venturing forth.  {x
30947.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {*The flooded coast that now holds the Mere spoils these lands for a
hundred miles to the north.  Abandoned castles and estates, partially
flooded and sunken into the waters, are scattered about, hollow shells
and a loose reminder of a time long ago.  {x
30969.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: The occasional tree and bush grow alongside the road here.  The
High Road no longer travels right on the edge of the coast, as this
part of the coast hasnt been eroded away like the more southerly part.
The Neverwinter Woods are not too far off to the northeast.
30930.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The mountains along the roadside sweep round to the north, forcing
the road to bend to the west.  At this point, the road seems to be cut
deep into the mountains, they rise higher and higher to the east, as
the level of the road gets lower.  To the west lies the sea of swords.
30908.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The road to the north seems to be coming out of the mountain range
to the south and is beginning to slope down towards sea level.  The
main part of the mountain range looms to the east while the road now
moves along some cliffs leading down to the sword coast.  The waves
from the sea can be heard pounding away at the cliffs below.
30976.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: A Path leads east to a small forest.  Running north along the
forest is a range of mountains, keeping the forest separate from the
much larger woods of {WN{we{Dv{Be{Dr{ww{Di{Bn{Dt{we{Wr{x to the north.  Back to the west, the
High Road continues on north to {WN{we{Dv{Be{Dr{ww{Di{Bn{Dt{we{Wr{x and south to the {DT{gh{De M{ge{Dr{ge
{Dof D{ce{Da{cd {DM{ce{Dn{x.
30972.name: {yA Small {gForest {yTrail{x

description: {DAll around, dark tall {gtrees {Dblock out the {wlight{D.  It is almost as
if it is constantly night under the {gtree {Dcanopy.  The {cwind {Dblows with
a {ccold {Dchill, and the occasional swaying {gbranch {Dlets in a beam of
{wlight {Dthat creates a swirling army of shadows dancing in the wind.
30979.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: {*To the west lies the submerged ruins of the Wolfhill House.  One of
the original structures built along the coast, the family owned large
portions of the land that now consist of the southern area of the
Mere.  Rumor has it the owner still walks the house at night,
aimlessly roaming the halls.  {x
30971.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: {DThe {gtrees {Dhere are even thicker than the rest of the {gforest{D.  This
corner of the {gforest {Dhas the most dense concentration of {gtrees {Dand
{gbushes {Dthroughout.  There seems to be no pathway through to the south.
Not far to the west, the trail back to the {yhigh road {Dcan be found.
30980.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: {wA broken down wagon lies on the side of the road, slowly
decomposing in the sunlight and moisture.  Clusters of mushrooms can
be seen growing in various places on the damp wood, thriving in the
briny ocean air..  {x
30950.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wTo the north lies the coastal village named {BP{bort {BL{blast{w.  The foot
traffic through this village looks light, as many of the walls appear
to be in ruins.  A pair of medium sized fortified watchtowers are
placed on the southern corners, and just to the south of the city,
along the coastline, is a large rock quarry.  Large cliffs loom
towards the east.  {x
30943.name: {BS{bouth {*of {BP{bort {BL{blast {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {y| {rAll ye travellers take note that   {y|
{y| {RWaterdeep{r, {RCity of Splendors {rcan   {y|
{y| {rbe found to the {Rsouth{r. There be    {y|
{y| {rseveral settlements to the {Rnorth   {y|
{y| {rfor those willing to brave the     {y|
{y| {rtreacherous journey.               {y|
The road continues to the north, towards a small mountain range.
The ground is heavily worn from the many carts, animals and travellers
that use this road.  There is a worn and tattered {ysignpost{x by the side
of the road pointing south towards the city of Waterdeep.
30901.name: {yNear The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wJust to the north lies {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr{w, city of craftsmen and
merchants.  It is a peaceful city, protected by heavily fortified
walls and a strong resident army.  The city was built in a well
thought out spot, with the resources of the ocean to the west, the
rich food sources of Neverwinter Forest to the east, and a large river
providing plenty of fresh water.  {x
30935.name: {BS{bouth {BG{bate {*of {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wContinuing along the High Road, a slight bend is up ahead curving
westward before curving back up to the north.  The road begins to
start a steady incline along a high cliff overlooking the Sea of
Swords.  {x
30946.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {*Sitting above the waters of the Mere, several spires of {*C{wa{Ws{wtl{*e
Na{re{Rry{rt{*ar{* can be seen extending up towards the sky.  Once the
centerpiece of the local coastal lands before they were flooded, the
stone-walled castle now lays abandoned, but structurally intact.  {x
30965.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: {cThe river here is running from north to south, through a cold
plain.  To the west, large lakes are frozen, and the Sea of Swords can
be seen far to the west.  Ice shards are forming on the water's
surface, making travel with a boat more difficult.  {x
30954.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: A small path runs through the edge of the Spine of the World.  To
the north, all that is visible is a large mountain range, covered in
snow.  A splendorous view to the south overlooks the ice lakes, and it
is possible to make out the town of Luskan far to the southwest, on
the coast of the sea of swords.
30997.name: {yPath Through The Spine Of The World{x

description: {DThis part of the {gforest {Dis a small {ggrove{D, sheltered from the {cwind.
{DThe {gtrees {Dstill black out most of the {wlight{D.  It is as if nothing is
here but the {gtrees{D.  Despite the lack of the {cwind{D, the {gforest {Dstill
feels very {ccold{D.  This is most likely because of the vicinity of the
forest to the frozen north.
30987.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: The narrow pathway between the mountains continues to the west and
the east.  The ice lakes are still visible way down below to the
south.  The path west leads to the town of Icewind Dale
30996.name: {yPath Through The Spine Of The World{x

description: {wThe High Road here runs alongside the upper edges of a long series
of hills, overlooking the northern edges of the Mere to the west.
Slowly creeping north, more of the coastline is consumed every year.  {x
30920.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wOvergrown bushes and tall grasses line the road here on both sides,
even encroaching onto the road itself.  The road here is unmanaged,
with people clearing vegetation only as needed to pass.  {x
30949.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {DThis small little co{wrner o{Df the forest is almost totally dark.  The
{Donly light that mo{wves am{Dong the trees is a single bright beam of
{Dlight, that look{ws almost {Dunnaturally created.  The light is coming
{Dfrom somewhere{w above th{De tree canopy, and it appears the trees have
{Dbeen cut in {wa specific {Dway by someone.  The beam of light hits a
{Dspecific p{watch of the {Dground, which is barron of all flora and fauna.
30982.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: {DLittle {ylight {Dcan penetrate this {gdark forest{D.  The {gtrees {Dare closely
knitted together and the {gground {Dis in constant shadow.  To the west,
{ymountains {Dblock the path back to the {gHigh Road{D.  All around, the {cwind
{Dblows a {cchill {Dinto the bones of every creature in the {gforest{D.
30973.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest{x

description: {DTall {gtrees {Dsurround everything in this {gforest{D.  It is very
disorientating.  There is virtually no {wlight {Dat all, and what {wlight
{Dthere is flickers down through the swaying {gtree {Dbranches high above.
The cool {cbreeze {Dblowing through the {gforest {Dis the only thing that can
be heard apart from the occasional chirp of a {ybird{D, or the snapping of
a twig.
30977.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: {gThe {Ylight {greaches most of this part of the {Dforest{g.  It has been
shaped into some sort of sacred glade, perhaps because the {Ylight {ggets
through only in this part of the {Dforest{g.  Nine {Dstones {gare arranged in
a circle around a central {Daltar{g, to {YS{yyl{gva{cnus{g.  The {cwind {gseems to have
died down a little, probably by some powerful magical enchantments.
30986.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: {DThe {yMountains {Dof the north work their way round to the east making
travel only {gpossible {Dback to the {gsouth {Dor the {cwest{D.  The {gtrees
{Dconverge around the edge of the {ymountains{D, creating spooky shadows on
the {ymountain {Dside.  What little {ylight {Dthere is reaches the {gforest
{Dfloor in small and beautiful {wbeams{D, lighting up the small {ganimals {Dthat
roam around the {gforest {Dfloor.
30988.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: The road is becomming more worn from travellers and merchants.
There appears to be an area beside the road that could be used for
either a small marketplace, or somewhere for travellers to rest a
while.  Far off to the northeast, the fabled neverwinter woods can be
seen.  Back to the south, the road continues towards some mountains.
30929.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe bridge over River Mirar is wide and sturdy, it's pillars
magically implanted deep into the riverbed.  During the springtime,
salmon can be seen swimming upstream to spawn, jumping out of the
water as they fight the current.  {x
30960.name: {BB{bridge {BS{bouth {*of {wL{Wu{Cs{ck{*a{Wn {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {cThe river reaches a tight bend here to the north.  The Crags block
all view to the south, while the Spine of the World, an enormously
high and dangerous mountain range shapes the horizon to the north.
30953.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: {cThe Spine of the World is directly ahead to the north.  The river
changes course here to the west to go around the mountains.  The light
begins to fade, as the tall snow covered mountains cast an ominous
shadow accross the river.
30992.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: Visible ahead to the north is a small trail into a dark forest.
The high road is built to bypass the forest and runs along the
cliffside.  To the south, a murky swampland is noticeable.
30925.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe ground here is heavily worn from the high traffic going in and
out of Waterdeep.  The soil is heavily packed, very much resembling
hard clay, and has been stripped clean of all vegetation.  A fork in
the road is up ahead, branching off to The Long Road to the north,
while the massive north gates of Waterdeep, the City of Splendors, can
be seen just a short distance away.  {x
30900.name: {yNearing Waterdeep {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {*Lands that used to be rich in nutrients, prime for agriculture,
that made landowners here some of the wealthiest along the Sword
Coast, have been destroyed forever by the salty waters of the sea.  {x
30970.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: There is a constant cold wind blowing along the road.  The road
runs north along the coast towards the towns of the north.  The
occasional bird can be seen flying over the sea to the west.  The
gicantic trees of Kryptgarden forest lie to the northeast.
30924.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: Standing at the cast iron gates of Waterdeep, the northern plains
beckon as the wind blows the tall grass and brings up an occasional
dust cloud from the dirt road that merges into Waterdeep City. The
occasional cart or wagon can be seen entering or exiting the city,
either full of trading goods, or embarking on a quest back home
after a successful day at the Bazaar.
30936.name: Outside the North Gates

description: The High Road is at it's peak here.  There is a tall mountain up
ahead to the north causing the road to bend round to the west, along
the edge of the sword coast.  To the west, the sea of swords can be
seen far off in the distance.  There appears to be a forest off in the
distance to the east past the mountain range.
30905.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {*The salty marsh deepens and it nears the Sea of Swords, dark in
color as silt swirls beneath with incoming the tide.  The mixture of
sand and mud beneath the surface gives way to the slightest pressure,
impeding the progress of those trying to walk through.  To the east
can be seen a partially submerged structure.  {x
30964.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: The High Road here begins to slope fairly steeply towads the north
as it enters a small mountain range.  There is still no vegetation
along the roadside.  As the altitude rises, the temperature begins to
drop.  There is a slight chill in the air as the winds start to pick
up a little, with a constant breeze.
30902.name: {yRoad through The Mountains {r-{y+{r- {yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The High Road looks well travelled here.  There are some noticeable
tracks of wagons and carts cutting into the muddy track below feet.
Over some of the hills to the northeast, the tall trees of Kryptgarden
forest can be seen towering into the skies
30923.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {cThe Spine of the World looms closer on the horizon to the north.
The icy waters are flowing slower here than downstream to the south
because of the sheets of ice forming on the surface.  The bitter wind
is all that keeps the river from freezing over, forcing the waters to
run at high speeds.
30990.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: {wThe High Road continues here to the north towards {BP{bort {BL{blast{w and to
the east towards {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr {r{w.  The Sea of Swords can be see to the
west.  {x
30942.name: {WN{we{*v{ge{*r{Ww{*i{gn{*t{we{Wr{w {GW{goods {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The High road begins to ascend upward again here along the
coastline.  It is rumoured that on a clear day, when there is no sea
fog or cloud, it is possible to see some of the northernmost of the
Moonshae Isles.
30928.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {cAs there is no longer any real shelter from the mountains, the cold
of the water, and the bitter chill of the wind is making the
temperature so low that all but the thickest of skinned animals would
probably perish.
30989.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: The road is appearing to get a little muddy here.  To the south and
the east, large mountains obscure the view of the road.  The High Road
is now right alongside the edge of the cliff to the west.  A careless
slip could mean a traveller would plunge to a watery grave in the sea
of swords.
30909.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The road here runs north to south between two particularly high
peaks.  These two mountains shelter the road from the cold breeze that
can be felt up among this mountain range.  The road is constantly in
the shadow of either of the two mountains and this makes it a suitable
place for an ambush.
30904.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe imposing North Gates of {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr{w stand tall here, designed
long ago to help resist the orc hordes that would come down from the
northern lands.  2 feet thick, reinforced with steel, and driven by
huge winches, they have protected the city well.  {x
30937.name: {BN{borth {BG{bate {*of {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {DThis appears to be somewhere near the centre of the dark {gforest{D. The {ymountains
{Dare just visible to the northeast, and the {gtrees {Dare as tightly {gwoven {Dtogether
high above in the {csky {Das anywhere else in the {gforest{D. There are {gtrees {Daround in
every direction, and it is {ydifficult {Dto see anything else. There are sounds of
many {yanimals {Dfrom all around as well as the {cwhistling {Dof the chilling {cwind {Dbreeze.
30983.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: You stumble upon a small clearing at the base of the mountain.
Stones and trees have been cleared away by some unknown hands, leaving
three markers of unknown intent.  There are faint inscriptions carved
upon each of the three markers.
30932.name: {xA {GC{glearing {xjust off the {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x

description: {wStill in the vicinity of {WN{we{*v{Be{*r{Ww{*i{Bn{*t{we{Wr{w, the road here is clearly
marked and well traveled.  To the south is Neverwinter River, who's
powerful currents flow year round, the city's citizens dependant on
it's resources.  A bridge to cross the river is to the east, while the
road continues to the north.  {x
30939.name: {WN{we{*v{ge{*r{Ww{*i{gn{*t{we{Wr{w {GW{goods {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: Apart from the smell, the only noticeable thing inside the cart is
a note.  It is tattered and hard to read.  Most of it is illegible,
but you can make out the following: Our cargo **********mere ****dead
m*****.  **** Another ***** ****** left inside ***tower.
**valuable*****abandoned.
The Road now is sloping quite steeply to the south.  There doesn't
appear to be any defineable tracks on the road here, indicative of an
unused and possibly dangerous route.  Along the side of the road is a
weather-worn cart, that appears to have been abandoned a long time
ago.
30907.name: {yRoad Through The Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The runes are strange and old, but they suggest some sort of
protection from something magical
The road continues accross several smaller hills, following the
coastline.  There are some strange old archaic runes embossed onto the
road surface.  Travellers who pass along this route seem worried as
they notice the runes, and hurry along.
30927.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {*The large salty swamp deemed the Mere of Dead Men covers 100 miles
of the coast near the Sea of Swords.  Continuously growing, it slowly
eats up more of the coastline, and enlarges the habitat of the vile
creatures that inhabit the domain.  {x
30962.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: {DThe {gforest trail {Dto the west opens out into a large clearing.  All
around are {gtall trees{D, casting moving and eerie shadows accross the
ground.  There are many footprints of small and large animals. The
occasional chirping of birds or {grustling {Dof {gbranches {Dbreaks the sound
of whistling {cwind {Dthrough the {gtreetops.
30975.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest{x

description: The road takes another sharp turn.  The erosion of the coastline
has prevented it from carrying on any further to the west.  It is
possible to see a few creatures lurking around under the water in the
sea of swords.  Far off to the south, many mountains are visible
accross the horizon.  Somewhere off in the distance to the northeast,
a large tower stands out on top of the hills.
30913.name: {yThe Open Road {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {cThe river begins to near the mountain range to the north.  The wind
is as cold and fierce as ever here.  The water is almost completely
frozen.  To the west, is a large frozen lake about 100ft in diameter.
30991.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: {*Standing along the edge of the {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{*, swampland can
be seen for miles extending to the west.  A once beautiful and wealthy
area of the Sword Coast, rising tides overwhelmed the low laying
coastal lands and turned it into a deadly swamp, crawling with
inhospitable creatures and abandoned buildings.  {x
30967.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: {wThe road moves outwards to the western edge of the woods, heading
towards the coastline.  Far to the northeast the peak of Mount
Holenow, a large, dormant, volcano reaches up into the sky.  {x
30941.name: {WN{we{*v{ge{*r{Ww{*i{gn{*t{we{Wr{w {GW{goods {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wContinuing along the High Road, this segment passes through the
dense forest of {WN{we{*v{ge{*r{Ww{*i{gn{*t{we{Wr{w {GW{goods{w.  Steeped in mystery and feared by
most men, rarely has anyone ventured far into the woods.  The road
continues to the north and south.  {x
30940.name: {WN{we{*v{ge{*r{Ww{*i{gn{*t{we{Wr{w {GW{goods {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: The High Road begins to descend down towards sea level again, into
the port town of {WN{we{Dv{Be{Dr{ww{Di{Bn{Dt{we{Wr{x. Lush green trees rise from the ground
alongside the road.  The Neverwinter Woods are now directly to the
northeast.
30934.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe High Road makes a final eastward turn as it starts to head out
of the hills and down towards more level ground.  The Sword Mountains
decorate the skyline to the east, and off in the distance from this
vantage point, small specks appear to be moving slowly in the sky.  {x
30919.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe vegetation here consists of light grasses and small bushes,
going through the normal cycle of a rich green pasture in the spring
and summer, drying out and recycling back to the earth in the autumn
and winter months.  {x
30918.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wTo the north is the drab, intimidating city of {wL{Wu{Cs{ck{*a{Wn{w.  Its
combination of seafaring merchants, pirates, isolation, and highly
suspect city rulers keep visitors out.  It is primarily a trade city
and has little hospitality to offer to those visitors not on business.
The walls are solid and fortified, with several ballista protruding
from the walls and lined up on top of the walls.  {x
30961.name: {BS{bouth {*of {wL{Wu{Cs{ck{*a{Wn {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wLarge trees to the east with overhanging branches cover the road in
shadows, while cool gusts of wind along the coastline flow in a
southern direction.  The road continues to the north and south.  {x
30948.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {wThe High Road makes a slight bend here and continues it's descent.
A bridge is just up ahead, offering passage above the River Mirar.
The river marks the last body of free flowing water before
overwhelming freezing temperatures take control.  {x
30959.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: More and more trees line the roadside.  The High Road is clearly
marked and a well worn path, but it is beginning to look more like a
the edge of the Neverwinter woods.  The road runs from south to north.
The sounds of a large fast flowing river can be heard from there.
30933.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {*Partially submerged here lies the {WH{wo{*l{wk {WH{wou{*se{*, still standing
structurally intact and proud.  The Holk family was one of the
wealthiest in the area, owning most of the prime central land, but
they lived frugally in a simple but sturdy house.  Constructed by
dwarven architects, the precise stonework and attention to detail is a
testament to the skill of the craftsmen.  {x
30966.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: {*Along the outer edges of the mere, the loose sand soon gives way to
the open waters of the Sea of Swords.  The stagnant water and murky
scents of the bog begin to clear as the incoming tide provides some
welcome relief.  To the south there appears to be a pair of towers,
long abandoned and in ruins.  {x
30968.name: {*T{gh{*e {*M{ge{*r{ge {*of {*D{ce{*a{cd {*M{ce{*n{x

description: The cliffside road continues on towards the frozen towns and cities
of the north.  To the south, a range of mountains towers above the
horizon.  The wind blows cold here, and the temperature is dropping
quite noticeably from that of the mountains, or the cities to the
south.
30911.name: {yNorth of the Mountains {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {DDense {gfoliage {Dblocks all travel to the south.  The {cwind {Dis blowing
with some force here.  The occasional {gwoodland {Danimal scurries along
the ground or jumps through the {gtree {Dbranches.  Shadows flicker with
the little {ylight {Dthat manages to penetrate through the {gtree {Dcanopy
high above.
30981.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: This stage of the High Road is the most notorious.  To the
northwest, {DT{gh{De M{ge{Dr{ge {Dof D{ce{Da{cd {DM{ce{Dn{x, a dangerous marshland swamp that many
ferocious creatures inhabit.  Travellers are advised to keep alert as
they cross this part of the road.
30914.name: {yNear Some Swamplands {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {cSnow covers the valley to the south, and it is just possible to
make out a frozen lake in amidst the slow.  The river is nothing but a
stream here, among the sheets of ice and the layers of snow.  The
river bends round to the north, in towards the Spine of the World
mountain range.
30993.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: This is the main part of the High Road.  It is a vital road for the
towns of the frozen north to use for trade and travel.  Although the
road is not the safest of places for a wary traveller, it is by far
the safest route to take.
30922.name: {yThe Main Artery {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {DWith all the {gtrees {Dsurrounding everything, blocking nearly all the
{wlight {Dfrom view, it is no surprise the animals and birds of the {gforest
{Dseem to be roaming around {cdirectionless{D.  There appears to be some
sort of small {ggrove {Dto the south, but with all the {gtrees{D, it is hard
to tell
30978.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: {cAlong the riverbanks, it is possible to see the Crags to the
southeast.  They are a tall mountain range, their peaks all covered in
snow.  The Neverwinter Woods are also visible to the south.  The wind
blows very bitterly here, as the choppy flow of the water indicates.{x
30952.name: {BM{birar {BR{biver{x

description: {wThe High Road continues both to the north and south.  This long
stretch of the road is disturbed little, with only the occasional
traveler passing through.  {x
30957.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {DThe {gforest is a {wlittle lighter {Dhere.  The tightly packed {gtrees {Dare
beginning to {gthin {Da little.  Some {wlight {Dis getting through and a few
{gplants {Dare {ggrowing {Dunderfoot.  More {yanimals {Drun around freely near the
{ymountains {Dto the {wnorth{D.  The {cwind {Dis still as {cchilling {Das ever,
perhaps more than the more {gsheltered {Dareas of the {gforest{D.
30985.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: {wThe road starts a steep descent towards the valley below.  The
temperature drops and weather begins to cool as the frigid north loom
on the horizon.  A short distance ahead the sprawling northern port
city of {wL{Wu{Cs{ck{*a{Wn{w can be seen.  {x
30958.name: {yThe Northern Heights {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x

description: {DThe dense concentration of {gtrees {Dis only broken by the large
{ymountains {Dto the north.  The shadows from the {gtrees {Dlay upon the
mountainside, and form shapes almost defineable but not quite.  The
{gtrees' {Dcanopy high above forms a tight ceiling of {gbranches{D, only
letting in the smallest of {wlight beams {Ddown to the surface.  Very
little but {ydirt {Dlies on the ground, since the absence of the {wlight
{Dmeans little can grow.
30984.name: {yK{gry{cpt{gg{car{gde{yn {gForest

description: NOT RESET IN UNTIL MPROG CAN BE WORKED OUT
30912.room_name: Mob for preventing easy access up
30912.name: mob for preventing easy access up~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M EXALL 30908 4~

description:
{8A large troll, about 6ft tall wades through the marshes, swinging a
club around ready to kill anything that moves, to make a tasty snack
from their bones.  {x
30913.room_name: A huge {*T{croll {xwades through the marshes, looking for victims.
30913.name: a lone {8M{xa{8r{xs{8h {8T{croll{x~

description:
This watchguard forever sits in watch over the mere and the
surrounding lands.
30914.room_name: {xa {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad {RW{ratchguard{x stands watch near the Mere.
30914.name: {xa {yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad {RW{ratchguard{x~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This priest walks swiftly on a small walking stick.  He is bundled
up in several layers of cloth with the garb of his clergy draped on
the outside.  The religious symbol which is embroidered upon the robe
is not like any you have seen, bearing angelic wings amidst a
starburst and surrounded by laurels.  His destination is as yet
unknown.
30915.room_name: A Priest from a Far Away Land travels the Northern Heights.
30915.name: A Traveling Priest~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

M GIVE 30917 10452~

M GIVE 30914 24350~
M GRALL 30910 100~

description:
{DA large troll, about 6ft tall wades through the marshes, swinging a
club around ready to kill anything that moves, to make a tasty snack
from their bones.  {x
30900.room_name: A huge {DT{croll{x wades through the marshes, looking for victims.
30900.name: a {DM{ga{Dr{gs{Dh T{croll{x~

description:
{DThis is a large alligator, about 7ft long, and is very strongly
built.  It moves with extreme speed and power under the waters, and
can barely be distinguished from other floating debris in the swamps. 
The only noticeable thing about it, is it's growling, and sharp teeth.
{x
30901.room_name: A giant {DS{gw{Da{gm{Dp A{cl{Dli{cg{Dat{co{Dr{x rises from the swampy waters to attack.
30901.name: a giant {DS{gw{Da{gm{Dp A{cl{Dli{cg{Dat{co{Dr{x~

description:
{DA large orc is here, wearing tattered and dirty leathers and animal
firs.  It has strange totems in it's hands, and appears to be
constantly mumbling in an orcish tongue.
30902.name: an {GO{grc {DS{gha{yma{gn{x~

description:
The man that stands before you is of average height.  He is
wearing a dark leather jerkin that looks well made, and is encrusted
with well polished silver studs.  Surrounding his body is a dark cloak
made of fine silks.  Small pouches hang heavy from his belt with what
appears to be coins of some sort.  The man appears to move lightly,
with grace and high agility.
30903.room_name: A bandit hides by the roadside looking for victims to rob.
30903.name: a roadside bandit~
subroutines:
M EXALL 30905 3~
M BRIBE 30904 10000~
M FIGHT 30903 40~

description:
{DThis tree is very large, the trunk grows in a spiral upwards, and
the branches flail around in the wind damaging things in their path.  
{x
30904.room_name: {DA Dark {gTwisted Tree{D grows here blocking the path.{x
30904.name: a {DDark {gTwisted {DT{gree{x~
subroutines:
F res L
F for AXYc
F par ADEFKLQVX
M EXALL 30906 0~
M EXALL 30906 1~
M EXALL 30906 2~

description:
{DYou see a tall bipedal lizardman.  It has a long tail, and and a
flicking forked tongue.  It is roaming around the mere of dead men
with it's own agenda.
30905.room_name: {DA tall L{gi{Dza{gr{Dd M{ca{Dn wanders about the Mere.{x
30905.name: a {DL{gi{Dza{gr{Dd M{ca{Dn{x~

description:
{DBefore you is a small dark green little goblin wearing tatty
leathers and is covered in some kind of dead foliage acting as
camoflage.  It has nasty little daggers and smells very dirty indeed.
30906.room_name: {DA {yS{gme{Dlly {gGoblin{D hides among the trees ready to attack.{x
30906.name: {Da {yS{gme{Dlly {gGoblin{x~

description:
{WThis wolf is a beautiful creature.  It has a thick white pelt that
looks like snowflakes resting on a cold skin.  There is a distinct
magical aura surrounding the wolf, very cold, and it's breath is like
a chilling winter breeze.
30907.room_name: An ice cold {Wwhite wolf {xsnarls towards you.
30907.name: a {WWi{Cn{wt{Ce{Wr Wolf{x~

description:
This Orc is fairly short, but very strongly built.  It is wearing
studded leather armor and as most orcs do, smells of dead flesh and
not having washed in months.
30908.room_name: A strong Orc roams the road looking for travellers to attack.
30908.name: an {GO{grc {GB{gan{ydit{x~

description:
Before you stands a stocky little dwarf with a fine red beard.  He
is about 3ft 6inches tall and similarly wide.  He is wrapped in many
firs, over his finely crafted dwarvern platemail, so that he can
travel the high road in rlative safety.
30909.room_name: A Stocky Dwarf Merchant travels along the High Road.
30909.name: A Travelling Merchant~
30909.t_flags: T Greetings, I wonder if you are interested in any of my goods.~

30910.room_name: A man loading the bandit mob is invis hiding here.
30910.name: mprog distributor~

F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M GRALL 30900 100~

30911.room_name: Mob to make the wind blow cold
30911.name: mob to make the wind blow cold~
